text: Idm reading msgs later and reply. I don't think that its possible to be online for both of us at the same time often anyway
ah ok i'll try and get back to you in maybe an hours  time as that when my lunch is

ah i was a bit late. there are render farms out there if you want to render on them. but to be honest i wouldn't. you want to work in game engine and it will be helpful to learn it and it will be quicker. if you really want to use a render farm there is scan which gives you i think £100 or £200 for free

but to let you know i used that within 2 days. because of how heavy my scene was. i think you still apply and try out the smaller studios as well. i would hit yourself over your skill level. it is good but probably not where you want to be or where you feel you should be. but it is good. you just have to challenge yourself to improve and that is what you're doing with this game which looked like it was coming on nicely. however that will come with time just keep at it and don't be discouraged. it happens to the best of us. when you're talking about bluezoo skill level that would want to see someone who is has liked worked on god of war or other triple games or films as i don't anyone that has come out of uni or in their second is at that second.

Hey Joe, I'd say get a couple of great stylized models done which I would recommend doing based off of professional concept art. Mainly because you want a strong foundation to create your models from and unless you are an exceptional concept artist there is no point in creating models based on your own designs. It's also useful to have a decent/good topology and showcase that with wireframes etc. Some experience with uving and texturing would also be a plus as we don't split the roles really. 
When I say good topology I mean like quads and subd style modeling
it will be more fun then

I think i will find some concept arts from animations/movies/games i like and try to make it. I think if i have 2-3 good works it will be enough. 
And now i am so scared about time :D like i have uni and i need to work on my own projects. I should work better on scheduling
Also, i know how to uv map, but i am bad with texturing. Can do only albedo map, but not bump or normal. Need to learn
